fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An item about the discovery of a dinosaur fossil in Somerset incorrectly described the ichthyosaur as a sea mammal; it was a marine reptile. The skeletal remains are believed to be 65m years old, dating it to the Cretaceous period, not the Jurassic as we had it. The accompanying image was for illustrative purposes only and not of an ichthyosaur skull (Say what?, 18 December, page 3, G2). • In a piece about the election result, we said: “The hurt caused to EU nationals living in Britain when the Tory leader accused them of treating it like their ‘own country’ cannot be underestimated either.” We meant overestimated (Whoever wins the election needs to show some humility, 13 December, page 4, Journal). • Other recently corrected articles include: ‘It’s a very harsh environment’: judge’s play shines light on family courts Catalogue of errors by Norfolk hospital led to death of baby PM bans ministers from Davos in nod to working-class voters
